intro: Uapaca nitida f. aucta, commonly known as the African wild coffee, is a shrub or small tree native to eastern and southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its elliptical, leathery leaves that are often glandular-dotted. The plant produces small, white flowers followed by yellowish or red berries, which are an important food source for various wildlife. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils in forested areas. Due to its ecological importance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and as a landscape plant.
